alert.note: Alert for Armstrong (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 31 at 8:35AM CDT until May 31 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Amarillo TX has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas... Prairie Dog Town Fork Red River at Wayside 13NE affecting Armstrong County. For the Prairie Dog Town Fork...including Wayside 13NE...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Prairie Dog Town Fork Red River at Wayside 13NE. * WHEN...From this morning to this evening. * IMPACTS...At 13.5 feet, Dirt road along south side of river is flooded. Cattle in the flood plain are threatened. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM CDT Wednesday the stage was 10.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:00 AM CDT Wednesday was 10.5 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 12.5 feet late this morning. It will then fall below flood stage this afternoon to 6.4 feet just after midnight tonight. It will rise to 7.6 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.5 feet on 05/27/1978. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 700 PM CDT.
